content.p: The complete list of supported methods for the current namespace is added to the Method dropdown box. This list is automatically generated using the WSDL file, so it is always accurate.

Selecting Methods
The user may scroll through the list of methods in the Method dropdown box and select the desired method. After selection, the results window will display the arguments required for the method, and an input will be generated for each of the required arguments (some methods do not require arguments).

To simplify method selection, the user may also click the icon and type a search word to locate a specific soap method. The search performed will be case-insensitive, and will only locate the first method that matches the criteria.
It is not necessary to type the entire method name in the search phrase. For example, typing "y2" would match the method "getTopology2."
The search feature will only examine the methods that are currently loaded in the Method dropdown list. If you can't locate a known method using the search feature, make sure you have Method Filter set to All and try again.

Method Filtering
For large method lists, it may be helpful to filter the methods to reduce the number of available choices.
Option Description
All (default) Filtering is off. All available methods are shown.
Gets Only methods beginning with 'get' are shown.
Sets Only methods beginning with 'set' are shown.
Other Only methods NOT beginning with 'get or 'set' are shown.
